intro: Heliophila pendula, commonly known as the hanging heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its drooping, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branching. Heliophila pendula is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance.
